title: Diana making a comeback... what hapn
body:
Why is she making a comeback? She is everywhere now. I saw a bit ago she had her w orb speed increased, doesn't seem like such a massive buff.. did I miss one? 

 I've been seeing her a bit lately ... is she just filling the gap of nerfed champs or is there another reason why she seems to be appearing more and more now -and doing well?

replies.body:
The small buff she got in 4.21 I think it was kick started people to pick her back up. The fact that a couple pros have played her on numerous occasions now means people are just going to copy them again.

To answer your question, Diana was one of the few AP assassins that didn't rely on DFG. So with that item gone, she gets faster power spikes then the assassins that needed to find new builds

Don't worry, she was a silent OP. Now that pros are playing her, she will be nerfed soon.

> [{quoted}](name=BarryButcher,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=1VgOxvPI,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-03-19T07:49:04.964+0000)
>
> The small buff she got in 4.21 I think it was kick started people to pick her back up. The fact that a couple pros have played her on numerous occasions now means people are just going to copy them again.
> 
> To answer your question, Diana was one of the few AP assassins that didn't rely on DFG. Sho with that item gone, she gets faster power spikes then the assassins that needed to find new builds
> 
> Don't worry, she was a silent OP. Now that pros are playing her, she will be nerfed soon.

ahh yeah, with DFG going it lifts her up that makes sense....
she's been good for a while, but with meta shifts she's passively become stronger. also 80% ap ratio on passive.
I don't know. I always played her, and mained her in the jg for ranked. I still haven't seen any :|

She was never weak. She always was a really good champion.

Now with the removal of DFG she is more stronger in comparison to those who needed it before, compared to and versing. She has a dash with no cool down if you keep hitting your Qs which aren’t hard, she’s got great base defensive stats which allows her to survive laning phase as a melee caster.

Also, her W buff was probably stronger than Riot intended. Now with the damaging spheres moving twice as fast, she can damage faster meaning she doesn’t need to stick to her target as long as she used to to blow up all 3 spheres and it also means she gains the shield a lot faster which scales quite well throughout the game.

Also, she has an AoE mini Orianna ultimate which synergizes well with other people’s ultimates providing she has the safety of Zhonyas and is a great champion to set up Last Breath.

So overall she was never a weak champion. I used to play her a lot with great success, but Kassadin fits me more :P
